Posts.Content: Hi there , I had a Hickman line inserted in my neck a couple of months ago . It means they can take bloods , give chemo or even antibiotics if needed without having to put a cannula in a vein , it's made my life so much easier whist having treatment no more making me cry with pain whist trying to cannulate . I did have to go to theatre to have it put in but it was just local anaesthetic and I was absolutely fine , it does make things easier . Hope your mum goes on ok xx

Posts.Content: Hi there , I'm new to this site , but I feel like I need to talk to other people going through the same as me . 4 weeks ago I had a lumpectomy and they said it was stage 1 grade 3 triple negative breast cancer , luckily it hasn't spread to my lymph nodes and this week I started my first round of chemo , I'm finding it really difficult to deal with I'm very teary and my head feels like it's being crushed as well as other side effects as anyone got any tips on dealing with this as I have a 2 year old to look after ..
Posts.Title: Coping with chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying ladies , I'm actually feeling a lot better today , I'm having 3 possibly 4 fec and the same amount of daxetocil depending on how well I am , they said they wanted to give me everything they can with me being young , fingers crossed the side effects won't get any worse and it will be worth it in the end , I think the worse thing for me now is waiting for my hair to start falling out , take care ladies xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi George and Jackie , I'm afraid they don't do the cold cap at my hospital , otherwise I would of give it a go . I am prepared iv had my beautiful long blonde hair cropped off and got myself a wig which looks pretty close to my new style and iv brought a few scarves and hats as well it's just the thought that's stressing me out I think when it's gone it will be a relief and I think my wonderful husband is actually looking forward to shaving it off ,I think he's slightly sadistic lol xxx
